Subject: Re: [neat] Novelty archive implementation with SharpNEAT
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=344770077; y=Mtnp-81kXllZ25qOw4ZKpWnVuZrW3aI3i_ZCuCtnl5Q1buNcCloa
X-Yahoo-Profile: alienseedpod
From: Colin Green <colin.green1@...>

Hi,

On 15 May 2017 at 22:00, milind.dalvi14@... [neat]
<neat@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
>
>
> I am trying to create a novelty archive on top of existing SharpNEAT project implementation.

[...]

> However, it seems that while adding Genomes using _hallOfFame.Add(ea.CurrentChampGenome) it actually adds
> reference to the genome from original IList<TGenome> genomeList which causes the _hallOfFame archive to
> update as population is updated!
>
> Is there any idea to actually add a ea.CurrentChampGenome as new object to the _hallOfFame archive?

I'm not sure what your specific problem is. Yes you are storing a
reference to an object rather than a copy of it, but that object
shouldn't be changing. Single parent reproduction is achieved by
creating a clone and mutating the clone's genes, i.e. the parent
remains unchanged. The same pattern exists for two parent
reproduction. So it's not clear to me what problem you are
experiencing.

If you really do want to clone a genome then there is a copy
constructor on the NeatGenome class that will achieve that, i.e.
actually make a  copy of the genome objects and all of its genes.

Hope that helps.

Colin
